title: Drawing, "Image of St. Blaise", ca. 1775
medium: Brush and gray watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on paper
markings: watermark:  crown above three circles with S below, D center
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right corner: F. Mergolo.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: St. Blaise kneeling and pointing at angels holding a tablet.  Near him on the ground two angels, one standing with the croizer, one sitting.  The mitre on the ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Image of St. Blaise", ca. 1775.
ca. 1775. Brush and gray watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4380.
